message.content: Yes, the authors include the total amount of compute and the type of resources used. In the experiments section, they mention that all the potential energies are trained using multilayer perceptrons with the Adam optimizer on a single Nvidia RTX 3090 GPU.

Yes, the authors include the total amount of compute and the type of resources used. They mention that they implemented their physical simulators using C++ and used PyTorch for learning the potential energies on a single Nvidia RTX 3090 GPU.

Yes, the authors include the total amount of compute and the type of resources used. They mention that their physical simulators are implemented using C++, and they applied PyTorch to learn the potential energies, which are then loaded into the simulators with TorchScript. All their potential energies are trained as multilayer perceptrons using the Adam optimizer on a single Nvidia RTX 3090 GPU.
